rules: Rule1: Either the developer attends the public hearing, or the developer sends a representative.
Rule2: Provided that the developer sends a representative, the developer hired a legal expert.
Rule3: Under the condition that the mayor is available, if the public hearing is scheduled, then whenever the developer attends the public hearing, the developer hired a planning consultant.
Rule4: Either the mayor is available or the deputy mayor is available.

Rule5: Provided that the public hearing is chaired, if the public hearing is scheduled, then under the condition that the developer attends the public hearing, the developer hired a planning consultant.
Rule6: If the commission chair is appointed, then in the event that the deputy mayor is available, the public hearing is chaired.
Rule7: Either the commission chair is appointed or the commission vice chair is appointed.
Rule8: Whenever the public hearing is presided over, if the deputy mayor is available, then the public hearing is chaired.
Rule9: In case there is a conflict of interest for the commissioner, the commissioner is impartial.
Rule10: Should there be a conflict of interest for the commissioner, then it is not the case that the commissioner is impartial.
Rule11: If the zoning variance is rejected, then it is not the case that the zoning variance is approved.
Rule12: Whenever a violation notice is issued, the developer is fined.
Rule13: In case a zoning violation is reported, if the developer violates the zoning bylaw, then a violation notice is issued.
Rule14: If the developer meets with the city planner, then provided that there does not exist a mitigation plan, the zoning variance is rejected.
Rule15: Under the condition that the developer meets with the planning director, should there not exist a mitigation plan, then the zoning variance is rejected.
Rule16: Whenever a meeting is requested, either the developer meets with the city planner or the developer meets with the planning director.
Rule17: Provided that the development application is submitted, the application review is accepted.
Rule18: Either the development application is submitted or the preliminary proposal is submitted.

Rule19: Under the condition that the preliminary proposal is submitted, if the developer requires an environmental assessment, then whenever it is not the case that if there does not exist a mitigation plan then the zoning variance is rejected, the development permit is approved.

Rule20: Whenever the technical assessment is completed, in the event that the developer requires an environmental assessment, then under the condition that it is not the case that if there does not exist a mitigation plan then the zoning variance is rejected, the development permit is approved.
Rule21: If special status is granted, then the expedited review is approved.
Rule22: In case an environmental appeal is filed, an administrative appeal is filed.

Rule23: Provided that an administrative appeal is filed, if it is not the case that whenever the application review is not accepted the technical assessment is completed, and the requirements are waived, then special status is granted.
Rule24: Either the developer requires an environmental assessment or the developer is exempt from an environmental assessment.

Rule25: Under the condition that the developer is exempt from an environmental assessment, provided that it is not the case that if there does not exist a mitigation plan then the zoning variance is rejected, the development permit is approved.

Rule26: If the developer hired a planning consultant, then in case the developer requires an environmental assessment, whenever it is not the case that should there not exist a mitigation plan the zoning variance is rejected, the development permit is approved.

Rule27: Provided that the developer hired a legal expert, if the developer requires an environmental assessment, then under the condition that it is not the case that if there does not exist a mitigation plan then the zoning variance is rejected, the development permit is approved.

Rule28: Either an appeal is submitted, or if it is not the case that either the developer hired a planning consultant or the developer hired a legal expert, then the environmental review is not completed.
Rule29: In case it is not the case that if the commission vice chair is appointed then the public hearing is presided over, there is a conflict of interest for the commissioner.
Rule30: Provided that it is not the case that if the application review is accepted then the technical assessment is completed, it is not the case that the requirements are waived.
Rule31: Under the condition that it is not the case that either the developer hired a planning consultant or the developer hired a legal expert, the environmental review is completed.

Rule32: Should it not be the case that if it is not the case that if there does not exist a mitigation plan then the zoning variance is rejected then the development permit is approved, the developer violates the zoning bylaw.
Rule33: Under the condition that there does not exist a mitigation plan, the zoning variance is approved.
facts: Fact1: The public hearing is scheduled.
Fact2: A zoning violation is reported.
Fact4: An environmental appeal is filed.
Fact5: It is not the case that the developer is fined.
Fact6: It is not the case that the development permit is approved.
Fact7: It is not the case that the expedited review is approved.
Fact8: It is not the case that an appeal is submitted.
